[209](#fig_209)). Leg 5 of male: basis of left leg simple, without inner expansion; right leg: basis and exopod forming a chela (fig. [210](#fig_210))</span><span class="keycol"><mark id="taxon_Tortanus">*Tortanus*</mark></span></p>

[212](#fig_212)) </span><span class="keycol"><mark id="taxon_Temora">*Temora*</mark></span></p> </div><div class=kblk><p class="leader indent4"><span class="keycol"><mark id="key_180">180</mark> ([178](#key_178))&nbsp;Leg 5 of female: 2-segmented on both legs (fig. Both leg 5 of female 3 or 4-segmented (fig. [215](#fig_215)); of male 4-segmented (fig. [216](#fig_216))</span><span class="keycol"><mark id="taxon_Calanopia">*Calanopia*</mark></span></p>

 <p class="leader indent4"><span class="keycol pad8">Urosome in female 3-segmented. Leg 5 of female 3-segmented on both legs, distal segment with 2 setae on inner margin and with terminal finer-like process, which may be finely serrate on one or both margins (fig. [217](#fig_217)); or ending in spine-like process, in points, or in a single, long sea-like spine (fig. [219](#fig_219)). Leg 5 of male 4-segmented on left and 3-segmented on right (fig. [182](#fig_182)), not chelate, ending in long feather-like seta (fig. [218](#fig_218)) or chelate (fig.
